words.title: Baboon
words.def: A large Old World ground-dwelling monkey with a long doglike snout and large teeth
words.sample: Such pets weren't limited to dogs and cats but included baboons, monkeys, and gazelles.

words.title: Dog
words.def: A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout, an acute sense of smell, non-retractable claws, and a barking, howling, or whining voice
words.sample: I asked, trying to make myself look as attractive as possible by batting my eyelashes wildly.

words.title: Bear
words.def: A large, heavy mammal that walks on the soles of its feet, having thick fur and a very short tail
words.sample: At Mama's urging, Sister makes a wish on a star for a toy bear.

words.title: Beaver
words.def: A large semiaquatic broad-tailed rodent native to North America and northern Eurasia
words.sample: These ethnic artefacts use interesting materials such as beaver fur, moose hide and deer toes.

words.title: Bee
words.def: A stinging winged insect which collects nectar and pollen, produces wax and honey, and lives in large communities
words.sample: The fly actually has a rather complex little ‘brain,’ as do bees, ants, and other higher insects.

words.title: Accredit
words.def: Give credit to (someone) for something
words.sample: However, he could not control reporters not accredited to his command.

words.title: Certificate
words.def: An official document attesting a fact
words.sample: He even had a birth certificate for me.

words.title: Campus
words.def: The grounds and buildings of a university or college
words.sample: University campuses became the rendezvous of students' organizations.

words.title: Cheating
words.def: Act dishonestly or unfairly in order to gain an advantage
words.sample: He was cheating Paul and Paul found out.

words.title: Enrollment
words.def: The action of enrolling or being enrolled
words.sample: In 1909-1910 it had an enrollment of 2631 students.

words.title: Archery
words.def: Shooting with a bow and arrows, especially at a target as a sport
words.sample: Live theatre, games, dancing, arts and crafts and archery, bring to life the Middle Ages.

words.title: Athletics
words.def: The sport of competing in track and field events, including running races and various competitions in jumping and throwing
words.sample: Sanchez's dominance of his event is almost unique in the world of athletics.

words.title: Basketball
words.def: A game played between two teams of five players in which goals are scored by throwing a ball through a netted hoop fixed at each end of the court
words.sample: You'll be able to watch live premiership games, basketball, golf, cricket, and all sorts.

words.title: Gymnastics
words.def: Exercises developing or displaying physical agility and coordination
words.sample: Evora was involved in gymnastics for several years, where her favorite event was the uneven bars.

words.title: Table tennis
words.def: An indoor game based on tennis, played with small bats and a ball bounced on a table divided by a net

words.title: Computer
words.def: An electronic device which is capable of receiving information (data) in a particular form and of performing a sequence of operations in accordance with a predetermined but variable set of procedural instructions (program) to produce a result in the form of information or signals.
words.sample: Clearly, not too many can afford to buy their own personal computers.

words.title: Data
words.def: Facts and statistics collected together for reference or analysis
words.sample: The data signal is stored in a first memory in response to the write clock signal.

words.title: Exponentiation
words.def: The operation of raising one quantity to the power of another
words.sample: exponentiation

words.title: Hardware
words.def: Tools, machinery, and other durable equipment
words.sample: Remove any easily removed hardware attached to the trim or mask hardware with tape.

words.title: Memory
words.def: The faculty by which the mind stores and remembers information
words.sample: And she would always whisper something of a past memory, perhaps a name, just before deep slumber.

words.title: Accident
words.def: A crash involving road or other vehicles
words.sample: All to make sure that the children get the opportunities they were denied by mere accident of birth.

words.title: Bus
words.def: A large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically one serving the public on a fixed route and for a fare
words.sample: She was already at the bus station.

words.title: Crossroads
words.def: An intersection of two or more roads
words.sample: He said that he believes that the industry is ‘at an important crossroads with our customers.’

words.title: Driver
words.def: A person who drives a vehicle
words.sample: I'm always fooling with new drivers, fairway woods and putters, but I don't switch very often.

words.title: Highway
words.def: A main road, especially one connecting major towns or cities
words.sample: It can be reached by highways from the major cities in Guangdong, Guangxi, and Hunan.

words.title: Absolute
words.def: Not qualified or diminished in any way
words.sample: Coming to any form of decision under these conditions was, in his opinion, an absolute miracle.

words.title: Accidental
words.def: Happening by chance, unintentionally, or unexpectedly
words.sample: It seems unlikely that the bright scarlet color is simply an accidental property.

words.title: Accurate
words.def: Capable of or successful in reaching the intended target
words.sample: It's been described as an epidemic, and I think that's an accurate representation, at this point.

words.title: Acknowledge
words.def: Accept or admit the existence or truth of
words.sample: He called her name but she refused to acknowledge him.

words.title: Alter
words.def: Change in character or composition, typically in a comparatively small but significant way
words.sample: This clothing was then altered to become liturgical dress.
